body:
In general I'd advise getting help from StackOverflow, though here I'm it's very unclear what the cause could be

* Can you provide a sample project that reproduce this?
* Can you provide the hprof file?
* What's the Android OS version and LeakCanary version?
* Is this a Samsung device?

I can't find MultiWindowDecorSupport in the Android source, so this doesn't look like a bug in AOSP. Seems similar to #1106 (closed due to lack of update).
Having the same logs here, did you solve this Seljad? It is happening in the Android 10 version only.

> Having the same logs here, did you solve this Seljad? It is happening in the Android 10 version only.

No, unfortunately, I haven't found a way yet.

issue.title: Add ref for known Samsung leak

repository.name: leakcanary
repository.description: A memory leak detection library for Android.

body: Hello, Did someone found a solution ? Is it happening only on Samsung device? @pyricau do you need a sample to reproduce ?
@yoobi starting with LeakCanary 2.4 this leak should be reported as a "library leak". https://square.github.io/leakcanary/fundamentals-how-leakcanary-works/#4-categorizing-leaks
Yes it is, so there is nothing to do to fix this leak ? Except wait for Android to do so ?
It looks like this is a samsung only bug (MultiWindowDecorSupport doesn't exist in AOSP), so you can report it to Samsung. You could also use reflection to clear the field.
Okay thank you, I'll try that out
If you end up with a fix that works, you can also contribute it back here: https://github.com/square/leakcanary/blob/main/plumber-android/src/main/java/leakcanary/AndroidLeakFixes.kt

I think I'm onto something but I can't get to make it work, I've managed to get the field:
```kotlin
val clearWindow = Class.forName("com.android.internal.policy.DecorView")
val field = clearWindow.getDeclaredField("mWindow")
field.isAccessible = true
field.set(null, null)
```

But when I do that in my Activity `onDestroy()` I get a crash. Could you guide me a little to fix this ?

> But when I do that in my Activity onDestroy() I get a crash

We can try, but you need to share a stacktrace :)
That beeing said, `field.set(null, null)` is wrong. Try `field.set(activity.getWindow().getDecorView(), null)`

You're right after changing to `field.set(activity.window.decorView, null)` I got a better crash
```
java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to start activity ComponentInfo{com.application/com.application.MainActivity}: java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'android.view.WindowManager$LayoutParams com.android.internal.policy.PhoneWindow.getAttributes()' on a null object reference
        at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2957)
        at android.app.ActivityThread.handleLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:3032)
        at android.app.ActivityThread.handleRelaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:4921)
        at android.app.ActivityThread.-wrap19(Unknown Source:0)
        at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:1702)
        at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:105)
        at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:164)
        at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:6944)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
        at com.android.internal.os.Zygote$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(Zygote.java:327)
        at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:1374)
     Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'android.view.WindowManager$LayoutParams com.android.internal.policy.PhoneWindow.getAttributes()' on a null object reference
        at com.android.internal.policy.DecorView.updateColorViews(DecorView.java:1337)
        at com.android.internal.policy.PhoneWindow.dispatchWindowAttributesChanged(PhoneWindow.java:3209)
        at android.view.Window.setSoftInputMode(Window.java:1062)
        at android.app.Activity.attach(Activity.java:7127)
        at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2878)
        at android.app.ActivityThread.handleLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:3032)
        at android.app.ActivityThread.handleRelaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:4921)
        at android.app.ActivityThread.-wrap19(Unknown Source:0)
        at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:1702)
        at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:105)
        at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:164)
        at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:6944)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
        at com.android.internal.os.Zygote$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(Zygote.java:327)
        at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:1374)
```

Looks like it is settings the new decorView to null, and makes the app crash.

I've got the following snippet:

```kotlin
override fun onDestroy() {
    super.onDestroy()
    // if manufacturer is Samsung
    val decorViewClass = Class.forName("com.android.internal.policy.DecorView")
    val field = decorViewClass.getDeclaredField("mWindow")
    field.isAccessible = true
    field.set(this.window.decorView, null)
}
```
wow, interesting looks like this happens on a config change, and the old window is somehow being reused.

> looks like this happens on a config change

Yes exactly , I'm changing the Locale of my app and when that happens I get the leak from `DecorView`
